intro: Paronychia johnstonii var. scabrida, commonly known as the scabrous sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and is often found in open habitats such as dunes or gravelly slopes. The varietal name "scabrida" refers to the rough or scaly texture of its leaves.
